description: Verify that the module test details page loads correctly with proper authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to a specific module's test details page to view module-specific tests
expected_results: Display the module test details page with header, module statistics, progress bar, and test plans list
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/modules/{module_name}
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check header with module name as title
5. Verify 'Back to Dashboard' and 'New Test Plan' buttons are visible

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the module test details page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access module-specific test management functionality
expected_results: Access should be denied with 403 Forbidden error
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/system-test/modules/Home Page
3. Verify 403 Forbidden error is returned
4. Check redirect to appropriate error page
5. Ensure no module test functionality is accessible

description: Verify that module statistics cards display accurate test counts for the specific module
scenario: Admin views module statistics to understand test progress and status for the selected module
expected_results: Display four statistics cards showing Total Tests, Passed, Failed, and Pass Rate specific to the module
procedure:
1. Navigate to module test details page
2. Verify 'Total Tests' card shows correct count for module
3. Check 'Passed' card displays green styling and correct passed count
4. Confirm 'Failed' card shows red styling and failed count
5. Verify 'Pass Rate' card displays percentage with yellow styling

description: Verify that module statistics calculations are accurate and match actual test data
scenario: Admin compares displayed statistics with actual test data to ensure calculation accuracy
expected_results: All module statistics accurately reflect the actual test data for the specific module
procedure:
1. Count actual tests in module by status
2. Compare with displayed statistics
3. Verify pass rate calculation: (passed / total * 100)
4. Check that pending tests are calculated correctly
5. Confirm all math is accurate and properly formatted

description: Verify the module progress bar displays correct completion percentage and visual indicators
scenario: Admin views progress bar to quickly assess module test completion status
expected_results: Progress bar shows correct percentage with proper visual styling and text labels
procedure:
1. Locate 'Module Progress' section
2. Verify progress bar shows correct width based on pass rate
3. Check gradient styling (green-400 to green-600)
4. Confirm text shows 'X / Y tests passed' format
5. Verify progress bar animation and smooth transitions

description: Verify the test plans list header displays correct count and filter options
scenario: Admin views test plans list to understand available tests and filtering capabilities
expected_results: Display test plans header with count, status filter, and priority filter dropdowns
procedure:
1. Locate 'Test Plans (X)' header
2. Verify count matches actual number of test plans
3. Check 'All Status' filter dropdown with options: pending, passed, failed, skipped
4. Confirm 'All Priority' filter dropdown with options: low, medium, high, critical
5. Verify filters are properly styled and functional

description: Verify the search input filters test plans based on test plan number and description
scenario: Admin searches for specific test plans using the search input field
expected_results: Search filters test plans in real-time based on test plan number and description content
procedure:
1. Locate search input with placeholder 'Search test plans...'
2. Type partial test plan number (e.g., 'STP-001')
3. Verify matching test plans remain visible
4. Clear search and type description keywords
5. Confirm filtering works for both test plan number and description

description: Verify that status, priority, and search filters work correctly in combination
scenario: Admin uses multiple filters simultaneously to find specific test plans
expected_results: All filters work together to show only test plans matching all selected criteria
procedure:
1. Set status filter to 'failed'
2. Set priority filter to 'high'
3. Enter search term in search box
4. Verify only test plans matching all three criteria are shown
5. Clear filters one by one and verify results update correctly

description: Verify that test plan cards display all required information with proper formatting
scenario: Admin reviews test plan cards to understand test details and current status
expected_results: Test plan cards show status badge, priority badge, test plan number, description, execution info, and action buttons
procedure:
1. View test plan cards in grid layout
2. Verify status badges with appropriate colors (green/red/yellow/gray)
3. Check priority badges with correct colors (red/orange/blue/gray)
4. Confirm test plan number and description display
5. Verify execution date and executed_by information when available

description: Verify that failure reasons are displayed correctly for failed tests with proper truncation
scenario: Admin reviews failed test cards to understand specific failure reasons
expected_results: Failed tests show failure reason in red-bordered box with appropriate truncation for long messages
procedure:
1. Create failed tests with various failure reason lengths
2. Navigate to module test details page
3. Verify failure reasons display in red-bordered box
4. Check long failure reasons are truncated (100 characters + '...')
5. Confirm truncation doesn't break formatting or layout

description: Verify that action buttons on test plan cards navigate to correct destinations
scenario: Admin uses action buttons to view, execute, and edit test plans
expected_results: Action buttons navigate to view, execute, and edit pages with proper test plan context
procedure:
1. Click 'View' button and verify navigation to test plan view page
2. Click 'Execute' button and verify navigation to test execution page
3. Click 'Edit' button and verify navigation to test plan edit form
4. Confirm all buttons pass correct test_plan_id parameter
5. Verify proper styling and hover effects on buttons

description: Verify the empty state display when no test plans exist for the module
scenario: Admin views module page when no test plans have been created for that module
expected_results: Display empty state with inbox icon, message, and link to create first test plan
procedure:
1. Navigate to module with no test plans
2. Verify empty state shows inbox icon
3. Check message 'No test plans found for this module.'
4. Confirm 'Create the first test plan' link is present
5. Verify link navigates to test plan creation form

description: Verify the no results state when search/filter criteria match no test plans
scenario: Admin applies search or filter criteria that match no existing test plans
expected_results: Display no results state with search icon and appropriate message
procedure:
1. Enter search term that matches no test plans
2. Verify 'No test plans match your search criteria.' message
3. Check search icon displays correctly
4. Clear search and verify test plans reappear
5. Test with filter combinations that return no results

description: Verify the page header contains proper title, description, and navigation buttons
scenario: Admin reviews module page header for clear navigation and context
expected_results: Display header with module name title, description, back button, and new test plan button
procedure:
1. Check page title shows module name (e.g., 'Home Page Tests')
2. Verify description 'Test plans for the {module_name} module'
3. Confirm 'Back to Dashboard' button navigates correctly
4. Check 'New Test Plan' button navigates to creation form
5. Verify proper styling and icons on all header elements

description: Verify the test plan cards grid adapts correctly to different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses module page from various devices to ensure responsive design
expected_results: Grid layout adapts from 3 columns to 2 to 1 column based on screen size
procedure:
1. View page on desktop (1920x1080) - verify 3 columns
2. Test on tablet view (768px width) - verify 2 columns
3. Check mobile view (375px width) - verify 1 column
4. Confirm cards maintain proper spacing and alignment
5. Verify filters and search remain usable on all sizes

description: Verify that filter changes update the display immediately without page reload
scenario: Admin changes filter options and observes real-time updates to test plan visibility
expected_results: Filter changes immediately show/hide test plan cards without requiring page refresh
procedure:
1. Change status filter and verify immediate card visibility updates
2. Change priority filter and confirm instant filtering
3. Type in search box and verify real-time search filtering
4. Combine multiple filters and verify immediate combined filtering
5. Clear filters and verify all cards reappear instantly

description: Verify that status badges display with correct colors and text for all status types
scenario: Admin reviews test plan cards to quickly identify test status through color coding
expected_results: Status badges use correct colors: green (passed), red (failed), yellow (pending), gray (skipped)
procedure:
1. Create test plans with all four status types
2. Verify 'passed' tests show green badges
3. Check 'failed' tests show red badges
4. Confirm 'pending' tests show yellow badges
5. Verify 'skipped' tests show gray badges

description: Verify that priority badges display with correct colors and text for all priority levels
scenario: Admin reviews test plan priorities to understand criticality through visual indicators
expected_results: Priority badges use correct colors: red (critical), orange (high), blue (medium), gray (low)
procedure:
1. Create test plans with all four priority levels
2. Verify 'critical' priority shows red badges
3. Check 'high' priority shows orange badges
4. Confirm 'medium' priority shows blue badges
5. Verify 'low' priority shows gray badges

description: Verify that long test plan descriptions are properly truncated in card view
scenario: Admin views test plan cards with varying description lengths
expected_results: Long descriptions are truncated with proper line clamping and visual indicators
procedure:
1. Create test plans with very long descriptions
2. Verify descriptions use line-clamp-2 CSS class
3. Check that truncated descriptions show ellipsis
4. Confirm card layout remains consistent
5. Verify full description is available when viewing test details

description: Verify proper error handling when module data cannot be loaded
scenario: Module page encounters an error while loading test data from the database
expected_results: Display appropriate error handling with 500 error page
procedure:
1. Simulate database connection error
2. Navigate to module test details page
3. Verify error is logged properly
4. Check 500 error page is displayed
5. Confirm no sensitive information is exposed to user

description: Verify that module name URL parameters are properly validated and handled
scenario: Admin navigates to module pages with various URL parameters including invalid ones
expected_results: Valid module names load correctly, invalid ones handle gracefully
procedure:
1. Navigate to valid module name URL
2. Try URL with non-existent module name
3. Test URL with special characters in module name
4. Verify proper encoding/decoding of module names with spaces
5. Check error handling for malformed URLs

description: Verify module page performance with large numbers of test plans
scenario: Admin views module page with hundreds of test plans to ensure performance
expected_results: Page loads efficiently and filtering remains responsive with large datasets
procedure:
1. Create module with 200+ test plans
2. Navigate to module page and measure load time
3. Test search filtering performance with large dataset
4. Verify status/priority filtering remains fast
5. Check memory usage remains reasonable

description: Verify the module page displays correctly in both light and dark themes
scenario: Admin switches between light and dark modes to ensure proper theming support
expected_results: All module page elements display with appropriate colors and contrast in both themes
procedure:
1. View module page in light mode
2. Switch to dark mode (if theme toggle available)
3. Verify all text remains readable with proper contrast
4. Check test plan cards use appropriate dark theme colors
5. Confirm status and priority badges adapt to theme correctly

description: Verify that filter states are maintained during navigation and actions
scenario: Admin sets filters, navigates away, then returns to verify filter persistence
expected_results: Filter states are preserved when returning to module page from other pages
procedure:
1. Set specific status and priority filters
2. Enter search term
3. Navigate to test plan view page
4. Return to module page
5. Verify filters remain as previously set

description: Verify that test execution information is displayed correctly when available
scenario: Admin reviews test plan cards to see execution history and executor information
expected_results: Execution date and executed_by information display correctly for executed tests
procedure:
1. Execute some test plans with different users
2. Navigate to module page
3. Verify execution date shows in MM/DD/YYYY format
4. Check executed_by shows username when available
5. Confirm execution info only shows for executed tests

description: Verify smooth animations and transitions enhance user experience
scenario: Admin observes page animations and card transitions for professional appearance
expected_results: Smooth fade-in animations on page load and hover transitions on interactive elements
procedure:
1. Navigate to module page and observe fade-in animation
2. Test hover effects on test plan cards
3. Check button hover transitions
4. Verify filter transitions are smooth
5. Confirm animations don't interfere with functionality

description: Verify module page works correctly across different web browsers
scenario: Admin accesses module page using various browsers to ensure cross-browser compatibility
expected_results: Module page displays and functions correctly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers
procedure:
1. Test module page in Google Chrome (latest version)
2. Verify functionality in Mozilla Firefox
3. Check display and features in Safari (if available)
4. Test in Microsoft Edge browser
5. Confirm all interactive elements work in each browser

description: Verify module page meets accessibility standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
scenario: Admin and accessibility tools test module page for compliance with accessibility standards
expected_results: Module page is fully accessible via keyboard navigation and screen readers
procedure:
1. Navigate entire page using only keyboard (Tab, Enter, arrows)
2. Test with screen reader for proper content reading
3. Verify focus indicators are visible on all interactive elements
4. Check color contrast meets accessibility standards
5. Confirm proper aria labels and semantic HTML structure

description: Verify that test plan cards have appropriate hover effects and visual feedback
scenario: Admin hovers over test plan cards to see interactive feedback
expected_results: Cards show shadow enhancement and visual feedback on hover without layout shifts
procedure:
1. Hover over test plan cards and verify shadow enhancement
2. Check that hover effects don't cause layout shifts
3. Verify hover transitions are smooth and professional
4. Confirm hover effects work on both cards and action buttons
5. Test hover behavior on touch devices

description: Verify module page integrates properly with broader test management workflow
scenario: Admin uses module page as part of complete test management workflow
expected_results: Module page provides seamless integration with dashboard, test creation, execution, and editing
procedure:
1. Navigate from dashboard to module page
2. Create new test plan from module page
3. Execute test from module page
4. Edit test plan from module page
5. Verify all integrations maintain proper context and navigation flow
